title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The Dow reversed early gains to close down 0.3% at a 52-week low, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose 0.3% and 1%, respectively.

The Senate voted to confirm Lisa Cook to the Fed, making her the first Black woman to sit on the central bank's board.

Prologis said it offered to buy Duke Realty in a nearly $24 billion deal, a vote of confidence in the e-commerce business.

Carvana plans to lay off 12% of its workforce after closing a deal that forced the online car dealer to borrow on onerous terms.

Pfizer agreed to buy the rest of Biohaven for about $11.6 billion, deploying cash from Covid-19 sales to acquire a new migraine drug.

Apple said it would discontinue its iPod Touch, a device that vastly expanded the company's reach in the music industry.

Sony and Nintendo said their flagship videogame machines are likely to be in short supply all year.

Car sales in China declined 36% in April from a year earlier, undermined by Covid-19 lockdowns.

What's News: Business & Finance
